chargeHist.descr: Attempt Armed Robbery with Use of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Antwon Laurel Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felony Murder-Attempted Armed Robbery as a party to a crime, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.03.
  • Felony Murder-Attempted Armed Robbery as a party to a crime, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.03.
  • Possession of a Firearm by A Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $3,464.80 to Doris T.  Joint and several with Bobbie White case 15CF714.  Payable first before any probationary costs or fees.

Pay all Court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.   Any amount remaining due and owing at the end of the sentence is subject to civil judgment and tax intercept or other means.

12-18-15/ Judge Ellen R Brostrom
The Court ordered that the order for 333 days of sentence credit is vacated. 
The JOC shall be amended to state zero (0) days of sentence credit on counts one, two and three
Consecutive to: Consecutive to counts  two and three, and any other sentence.  Credit for 0 days

superMiscConds.notes:
No drugs or alcohol, unless medically assisted treatment.
Do not frequent places where alcohol or illegal drugs are sold, distributed or used.
No association with any known gang member, associate or affiliate.
No firearms, weapons.

Cognitive intervention programming.
Participate with the Dept. of Vocational Rehabilitation and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.

cf

Defendant Antwon Laurel Jones in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Antwon Laurel Jones in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for sentencing hearing.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by Brittany M., Louis B. and Doris T.  Colloquy with defendant regarding defendant's criminal history as cited in the PSI.

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 25 YEARS, with credit for 333 days time served, consecutive to Count 2 and 3 and any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 7 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 25 YEARS, with credit for 0 days time served, consecutive to Count 1 and 3 and any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 7 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 3: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS, with credit for 0 days time served, consectutive to Counts 1 and 2 and any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

AS TO COUNTS 1-3: The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Defendant to participate in alcohol and drug assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol. Unless medically assisted treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* DO NOT frequent places where alcohol or illegal drugs are sold, distributed or used.
* No association with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
* No firearms; weapons.
* Participate with the Dept. of Vocational Rehabilitation and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Restitution payable to Doris T. for $3,464.80 joint and several with Bobbie White, case #15CF714. Payable first before any probationary costs or fees.
*Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing at the end of the sentence is subject to civil judgment and tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
ALTERNATIVE PRESENTENCE INVESTIGATION REPORT, received and filed. lms
ORDER TO PRODUCE

Defendant Antwon Laurel Jones in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Antwon Laurel Jones in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defense is requesting an adjournment.  Defense has hired a PSI writer, who has not had a chance to meet with the defendant.  State's victim's family is present in court.  Court admonished defense for late notification of request.  Court reluctantly GRANTS defense request.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Re: Restitution from County of Milwaukee Distric Attorney's Office, recieved and filed. lms
Request for payment of $68 witness fees for witness Doris T. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26211714 in court 4x on 8/3, 8/5, 8/6, & 8/7/15.
Witness fee request prepared for Shaquille, S.. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

At the hour of 4:14pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY as to the lesser included for counts 1 & 2 which was then read and GUILTY as to count 3.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted State's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied Defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 6.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 05:01 pm.

Defendant Antwon Laurel Jones in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Antwon Laurel Jones in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Certified documents received and marked as exhibit 186.

Jury in box at 1:21.
Trial resumed with closing instructions.  Closing agruements from ADA Sara Lewis and Attorney Eric Hailstock.  Rebuttal arguments by ADA Sara Lewis.

Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 2:20pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff Deputy Steven Sanfilippo and Joseph Zielski who was duly sworn for that purpose.

Juror question to see exhibits 88-96 discussed and granted.

Defendant Antwon Laurel Jones in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Parties address the closing instructions and other trial matters.

Jury in box at 11:22am.
State seeks to briefly reopen case.  Court take judicial notice of the criminal complaint and other documents regarding the co-defendant case.   The evidentiary phase is now close.

Closing instructions on the law.  Jury out of box at 11:58am.  Court recessed for lunch.  Jury trial scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Witness fee request prepared for Doris T. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

Defendant Antwon Laurel Jones in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Antwon Laurel Jones in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Jury in box 1:30pm.  Trial continued.  Sworn for the state:  Angela J. and Ivori W. on direct examination.  Cross-examinaton.  Re-sworn for the State:  State recalls Officer Gary Post and Det. Kevin Klemstein, Det Brian Hardrath on direct examination. Exhibits 176, 177 & 178 offered into evidence by State and received by the courts.  Sworn for the State:  Doris T. on direct examination.  Exhibit 177 is published to the jury.  Re-sworn for the State:  State recalls Ivori W. on direct examination.  Sworn for the State:  Shaquille S. on direct examination.  Jury out of box 3:20pm.  Court took a brief break.  Back on the record at 3:29.  Jury in box at 3:35.  Trial continued.  Sworn for the State: Brian Linert (Asst. medical examiner).  Re-sworn for the State:  Det. Timothy Graham on direct examination.  Exhibits 161 & 179- 184 offered into evidence by State and received by the courts. Court read the stipulation on the record, which was signed by all parties.
State rests subject to rebuttal.

Jury out of box at 4:13pm,
Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waived right to testify.
Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Testimony closed.  Jury in box 4:31pm.  Trial to resume 8/7/2015 at 9:30am.  Jury out of box 4:32pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Antwon Laurel Jones in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Jury in box at 10:15am.  Trial continued.  Testimony continued with Det. Timothy Graham on cross-examination.  Re-direct examination.  Exhibit 6 offered into evidence by State and DENIED by the Courts.  Sworn for the state:  Melissa M. Graf (forensic scientist) Stephanie Kuntz (Sr. DNA analyst) on direct examination.  Exhibits 171 & 172 offered into evidence by State and received by the courts.  Sworn for the state:  Mark Simonson (fireare and toolmark examiner) on direct examination.   Exhibits 173, 174 & 175 offered into evidence by State and received by the courts.  Jury out of box at 11:46am.  Trial to resume at 1:15pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Antwon Laurel Jones in court with Attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Antwon Laurel Jones in custody.  
Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Case recalled.  Jury in the box at 1:36 p.m  Trial continued.  Testimony of Det. Britt Kohnert resumed (previously sworn).  Exhibits 86, 87, 97-117, and 135 received into evidence.  Exhibits 86, 87, 97-112 published to the jury.  Sworn for the state:  citizen witness Rodtrell C.  Recalled: Milwaukee Police Officer Gary Post.  Exhibits 136 and 137 offered and received into evidence.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Detectives Robert Laloggia and Jeffrey Sullivan.  Exhibits 118-120 received; 121-134 received and published; 139-143 received.  Jury out for break at 3:19 p.m.; jury in 3:39 p.m.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Detective Billy Ball.  Recalled: Milwaukee Police Detective Timothy Graham.  Exhibits 144-158 received and published.  Exhibits 167-170, 162-166, and 160 received into evidence.

Jury given instructions and released for the day at 4:53 pm.  Sidebars set forth on the record.  Exhibit 138 received.  Exhibit 161 offered, defense objects, Court to address on tomorrow.  Court in recess.  Case continued to 8-06-15 at 10:00 a.m. for Jury Trial before Branch 06.

Defendant Antwon Laurel Jones in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Antwon Laurel Jones in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Jury in box 10:30.
Trial continued.  Sworn for the state: Officer Gary Post on direct examination.   Exhibits 76-78 and 79-85, offered into evidence by State, received by the courts and published to the jury.  Cross-examination of State's witness.
Jury out of box at 10:58.

MIRANDA GOODCHILD HEARING PROCEEDED.
Sworn for the State:  Det. Britt Kohnert on direct examination.  Cross-examination.  Re-direct examination.  Sworn for defense:  Defendant Antwon Laurel Jones in direct examination.  Cross-examination.  Re-Sworn for defense:  Det. Britt Kohnert on direct examination. Cross-examination.  Re-Sworn for the State: Officer Gary Post on direct examination.  Cross examination.  Sworn for the State: Det. Timothy Graham on direct examination.   Court heard arguments as to the Miranda motion. Court DENIES the motion and places reasons on the record.

Jury in box at 11:45.
Sworn for the State:  Det. Britt Kohnert on direct examination.   Exhibits 88-96, offered into evidence by State and received by the courts.  Exhibits to be published to the jury after lunch.  Jury out of box at 11:56am. Trial to resume at 1:30pm
  Jury trial scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Antwon Laurel Jones in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Antwon Laurel Jones in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Jury in box ar 1:50.  Trial continues with previously sworn Sgt. Stephen Chin under direct examination. Cross-examination of State's witness.  Re-direct of State's witness.  Re-cross of State's witness.

Sworn for the state:  Quinnita S. on direct examination.   Exhibits 7 offered into evidence by State and received by the courts.  Exhibit 5 is received and published to the jury.  Cross-examination.  Sworn for the state:  Det. Timothy Graham on direct examination.  Exhibits 8 thru 15 offered into evidence by State, received by the courts and published to the jury.  Jury out of box at 3:25.  Court took a brief break.  Jury in box at 3:52.  Trial resume with previously sworn Det. Timothy Graham on direct examination.  Exhibits 43 thru 59 offered into evidence by State, received by the courts and published to the jury.  Cross-examination.  Re-direct examination.  Exhibits 73 thru 75 offered into evidence by State, received by the courts and published to the jury.  Re-cross examination and re-examination.  Exhibits 16 thru 42 and 60 thru 69 offered into evidence by State, received by the courts and published to the jury.

Jury out of box at 4:38pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Antwon Laurel Jones in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Antwon Laurel Jones in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

State submitted opening instructions.  Element #162 and the sentence below element #2 is struck.

Defense request a Miranda Goodchild motion.  Court to address the Miranda Goodchild motion after state's officer testifies.

Jury in box at 10:41am.
Court instructed the jury on Opening Instructions on the law.
Opening statements by ADA Sara Lewis and defense counsel Eric Hailstock.

Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Sgt. Stephen Chin on direct examination.   

Exhibits 1, 2, 3 & 4 offered into evidence by State and received by the courts and published to the jury.   
Jury out of box at 11:55am.  Court recessed for lunch.  Trial to resume at 1:30pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

PM SESSION...

Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 2:57. 

JURY OUT.
Court took a brief break.

BACK ON THE RECORD.
Strike for cause done on the record.

JURY IN BOX.
Fourteen (14) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered. 

Court released the jurors for the day and ordered to return at 9:30 on 8/4/2016.

Defendant Antwon Laurel Jones in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Antwon Laurel Jones in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Jury panel in court and sworn at 11:56am.  Court recessed for lunch.  Voir dire to begin after lunch.

IT IS HEREBY STIPULATED by and between the State of Wisconsin, by Assistant district Attorney Sara B. Lewis, and Attorney Eric Hailstock, attorney for defendant Antwon Jones, that the defendant was previously convicted of a felony, and that said conviction was of record prior to the date of January 2, 2015.  Further, said felony conviction remains of record and is not reversed.  Received and filed. lms

Defendant Antwon Laurel Jones in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Antwon Laurel Jones in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Parties ready to proceed to trial.  Case passed.
